edu.internet2.hopi.dragon.terce.api
Class App2TERCERequest

java.lang.Object
  edu.internet2.hopi.dragon.terce.api.App2TERCERequest

public class App2TERCERequest
extends java.lang.Object

Contains the parameters of a TERCE API application request. TERCE application requests are used to retrieve a path between two endpoints and optionally available VLAN tags. App2TERCERequests are issued to the TERCE server by TERCE clients.

Author:
Andrew Lake (alake@internet2.edu)

Constructor Detail

App2TERCERequest

public App2TERCERequest(java.lang.String src,
                       java.lang.String dst,
                       byte encoding,
                       byte swcap,
                       byte[] gpidNum,
                       float bwidth)
                throws java.net.UnknownHostException
Constructor that generates a request using specific values for encoding, switching capability, and gpid

Parameters:
src - the address or hostname of the source to be used in the path computation
dst - the address or hostname of the destionation to be used in the path computation
encoding - the encoding to use along this path
swcap - the swicthing capability of the path
gpidNum - the GPID of the path
bwidth - the bandwidth required along the path
Throws:
java.net.UnknownHostException - returned when an invalid source or destination is given

App2TERCERequest

public App2TERCERequest(java.lang.String src,
                       java.lang.String dst,
                       float bwidth)
                throws java.net.UnknownHostException
Constructor that generates a request using default values for encoding(ethernet), switching capability(l2sc), and gpid(ethernet)

Parameters:
src - the address or hostname of the source to be used in the path computation
dst - the address or hostname of the destionation to be used in the path computation
bwidth - the bandwidth required along the path
Throws:
java.net.UnknownHostException - returned when an invalid source or destination is given

getType

public byte[] getType()
Returns the TLV type in the body of this request. It is always 2 for this type of request.

Returns:
the TLV type in the body of this request (always 2)
